replies.replyComment: I agree with you lot of contradictions and not enough evidence based conclusion to prove his concept. During Buddhas visit there have been two tribes Yaksha and Naga, what happend to this second tribe Naga. Looks like Vijay and his men colonised Sri Lanka and both these tribes got mixed and joined with new invaders and over the time with arrival of new migrants, a new nationality called Sinhalese born. Best way to find our routes is to do a DNA check and trace back to India and Balangoda man. Since Vijay and his gang has been characterised as notorious, any form of prior Buddhism or culture would have got distroyed by the time of King Dewanam Piyathisa

replies.replyComment: Why did Buddhagosha burn all the previous written documents after presumably having translated them ?  That was a serious error of judgement or was it done purposely to avoid disclosure of erroneous translation of the Buddhist scriptures. Even otherwise a sage would never burn what were considered sacred religious records. The loss is immense as antiquities as well. And apparently nobody heard of him again after he returned to India !

Mahaththayo mihindu himi lankawata budu dahama genawa kiyala tiyenne senarath paranavithanage mahawanshaye. Vijaya kiyana pal hora gen lankawe shishtacharaya arambha una kiyala tiyenne e pothe. Ethkota rawaana gena kisiwak sandahan nokranna inna taram senarath paranavithana sookshama una. Itin obathuma senarath paranavithana kiyana thakkadiyage pacha potha kiyawala nam comment karanne mata godak kanagaatui. Rawana gena lankawe witharak nemei. Indiaweth prasiddai. Ethkota lankawe apita harima sekai rawana hitiyada kiyala. Ay itin chuty kale indala iskole me patta pal boru ugannanawa. Apith ewa kata paadam karala exam pass wenawa. E nisa mahattayo poddak hoyala balala katha karanna. Sigiriya kashaya nemei haduwe. Kashyapa kare eka poddak aluthwediya karapu eka withrai. Anika rajathumek kawadawath sigiri gala dige elli elli udata yaida? Ko sigirya udata yanna tibba gala athulen hadala tibba maargaya? Ewa hoyala balala katha karoth hondai obathuma.

comments.comment: Superiority complex, just as inferiority complex is not the "middle path." To be in the present moment by setting up mindfulness in the four modes of deportment (sathara sathipattana) is more noble than wasting time pontificating and making grandiose claims about history based on inscriptions on the face of a rock, which may tantamount to nothing more than graffiti of the times without a basis in truth. No one can know for certainty what happened or when it happened, but the assurance that unbroken lineage of monks transmitting the instructions left by the Buddha on the path to liberation is what we hold as Dhamma in the Noble Triple Gem. However, when even liberation is not complete until one lets go of the Noble Triple Gem that helped one to travel on the path (magga), why should we waste out time with assumptions & beliefs that form the moving target called 'culture.'
comments.author: Anil Baddevithana

replies.replyComment: If the history is distorted, many pieces of content in Thripitaka can be shown to the uninformed as a collection of fabricated stories. That could cause the people to mistrust the truth and hence affects the continuation of Buddha Sasana. Second, the meaning of Pali words can be misinterpreted according to the rules of a another language (like Sinhala - say after falsely claiming that the Lord Buddha was born in Sri Lanka). That leads to the interpretation of Dhamma with distorted meanings. History and language are important for the continuation of Buddha Sasana.
ehenam machan uba danatamath avabooda karagena athine.
